text: DONNA JURKA, DULY SWORN DIRECT EXAMINATION
All right.  Ms. Jurka, am I saying your name the right way?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Jurka.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.  I will try to remember that.  My name is Jackie Kaplan, and I introduced myself to you off the record this morning, but so the record is clear, I'm going to be asking you probably most of if not all of the questions today. First I'll just ask Attorney Donohue if we can agree to the usual stipulations?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.  That's agreed.
speaker: MR. DONOHUE

text: And I'll put them on the record just to be clear.  So first of all, all objections except as to form are reserved, motions except as to strike are reserved.  An objection by one Defendant is good for all Defendants, and although I don't think that this is an issue, I will put it on the record, appearance today does not waive any jurisdictional claims or defenses including those related to service of process. Are those all agreed?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Those are agreed.
speaker: MR. DONOHUE

text: Excellent.  Ms. Jurka, have you ever been deposed before?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  I'll set out a few rules and we'll try to go from there.  So the first and most important thing is that we have a court reporter here today which you may have noticed, and so you and I are going to do our very best or I'll ask you to do your very best not to speak over one another so try to let me finish my question before you answer and I'll try to let you finish your answer before I ask my next question. Next is that all your answers do need to be verbal today because we can't take down a head nod or a head shake or anything like that.  So I'll ask that you say yes and no or anything else that you have to say. If you answer a question that I ask, I'm going to assume you understood my question. However, if you don't understand my question or you want me to rephrase it, just let me know and I'm happy to do so. If you need a break you can let us know and we're happy to take a break.  You just need to answer the one question if it's pending at the time, and then we'll take a break. Understand all of that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.  Okay.  And then one other rule I like to mention is that this is what we call a discovery deposition, and what we mean by that is we're trying to discover whatever information you are aware of and recall, and we want to make a record of that.  We don't want you to guess as to anything.  So if the answer to a question is either I don't know or I don't remember, those are perfectly acceptable answers.  We just don't want you to assume or guess or anything like that.  All right?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: (Nods head.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that yes?
speaker: COURT REPORTER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's only natural so we'll try to remind you. One other question.  Are you represented by counsel today?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No, I'm not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Have you spoken to Mr. Donohue who represents your brother?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, I have.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you speak to Mr. Donohue before today?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, I have.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you spoken with anyone else from Mr. Donohue's office?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many times have you spoken with Mr. Donohue before today?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Twice.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when were those occasions?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: He called me two or three weeks ago and we spoke at that time, and then he called me again on Monday or Tuesday and we spoke then.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Oh, he also came to my house.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When was that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: In the two or three week time frame, shortly after I had spoken to him on the phone.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So he visited your home between the first and second phone call you had with him?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The first phone call, the one that was 2 to 3 weeks ago, how long was that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: About a half an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you discuss?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: We discussed broadly what I knew about my brother's condition and about the new heating system that was installed in the family home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And I'll ask you more about those in a few minutes. When Mr. Donohue visited you at your home, how long was that visit?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: About half an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you discuss during that visit?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: The same thing.  He spoke about the deposition, some of the things that you just went over, what would be happening.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: A little preview?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you spoke on Monday or Tuesday of this week, how long was that call?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: 20 minutes?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you discuss during that call?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Pretty much just reviewed the same things. Nothing different.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than conversations with Mr. Donahue, have you done anything else to prepare for today's deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you spoken with your brother about today's deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Only to the extent that he knows it's going on.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is your brother the one who originally told you you might be deposed in this case?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you say only to the extent he knows what's going on, what do you mean by that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I told him that I had spoken to Matt and that there would be deposition that they wanted me to come to.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you speak with your brother about what Matt had told you would be the substance of today's deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you spoken with your brother about the deposition more than one time?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When your brother was originally deposed back in March, did you speak with him about that deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I knew it was going on, but we didn't discuss what was talked about at the deposition.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did you believe was going on at that deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I knew there was a law case concerning the mesothelioma.  So I believed it was discussion, you know, how to put this.  About the law case.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood.  Other than the medical diagnosis and condition, the mesothelioma, did you understand what else was discussed at the deposition in March?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I knew nothing about the deposition other than the fact that there was one.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I'll ask you the same question about Day 2 of your brother's deposition which was last week or the week before?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I knew there was a second deposition.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you speak with your brother about that deposition?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Only that he told me it was very short.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So let me ask you because you mentioned that your conversations with Mr. Donohue were related to both your brother's condition as well as the new heating system in your home.  Is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you speak with your brother about that new heating system that was in your home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you close with your brother?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, I understood, correct me if I'm wrong, that you live next door to one another?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: We do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you lived next door to one another?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Six years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your address?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: 581 Scenic Road, Unit 6, Laconia.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did you live before that address?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Smithfield, Virginia.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long had you lived in Smithfield, Virginia?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: 8 years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were you doing in Smithfield?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: My husband was employed by the military, Air Force and the Navy, and that's how we got there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you remain close with your brother during that time?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.  My parents lived very close to him so when I visited my parents I saw him regularly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That was in New Hampshire?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No, in Massachusetts.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Back in Massachusetts.  Would you say that you've always had a close relationship with your brother?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can I have you state your full name for the record which I probably should have done a few moments ago but we'll do it now.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Donna Marie Jurka.  J U R K A.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is your maiden name?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Bixby.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your date of birth?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Where were you born?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Haverhill, Massachusetts.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I should have asked you.  Do you have any plans to move from the 581 Scenic Road address?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who do you live there with?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: My husband.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your husband's name?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Valdis.  V A L D I S.  Jurka.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any children?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.  I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many children do you have?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I have three living children.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do any of them live with you?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than your husband, does anyone live with you?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you currently on any medications?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, I am.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I won't ask that you list them all.  I'd just ask whether any of those medications affect your memory or ability to testify here today.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So I'm going to jump right into one of the things I believe you discussed with Mr. Donohue, and that's that new heating system in your home on Stone Avenue.  Is that the address you're referring to?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, it is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And it was One Stone Avenue?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'll represent to you that your brother testified a new heating system was installed in approximately 1961.  Does that ring true with your memory?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.  I would have said 1959, but --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Why is that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: That's just my memory of it, and, you know, I was very young so --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Your memory controls so you can just say whatever you remember.
speaker: MR. DONOHUE

text: I remember it as I was being 8 years old so it would have been 1959.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is it that you recall about being 8 years old or how are you recalling 1959?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: And I don't know why I remember it this way, but all my life I have remembered being 8 years old. I helped my father install the heating system so it wasn't just something happening in the background.  I was involved.  And in my mind I was always 8 years old.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it something you've spoken about in the years since you did it?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: It might have been mentioned some place along the line, but no, no big discussion of it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what grade you were in in school?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there anything else going on at the time that you can recall simultaneously?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you believe you were 8 years old which would have made your brother 10; is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long had you lived in the One Stone Avenue home before this heating system was installed?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Four years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Your recollection is that you moved into the One Stone Avenue home in 1955 approximately?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you recall any addresses you lived in prior to 1955?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: We lived, no, I don't know if it was Broadway or North Broadway in Haverhill.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall the number?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall anything that that home was nearby?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: A school, a supermarket, anything like that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that the only other home you lived in before Stone Avenue?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.  I lived somewhere else.  My father was building the house on Broadway/North Broadway, when I was born.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know whether the other home you lived in was in Haverhill?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, it was.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know whether your parents owned that other home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes, they did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And obviously they owned the home on Broadway or North Broadway because your father was building it?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know how long it took your father to build that home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Well, I would say probably four years.  It was continuously under construction until they moved.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you move into the home before, during or after the construction?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Probably to some extent during.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So going back to the One Stone Avenue, you believe you lived there for four years before this new heating system was installed; is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said you participated or you helped your father install the new heating system?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was -- and you were 8 years old at the time?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your role in the installation process?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: A lot of fetching, cutting pipe, putting pipe dope on the pipes as they were being connected, holding things.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How are you cutting pipe?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: My father had a pipe cutter, had actually two different ones depending on the size of the pipe that was used being used, and he had set it up, and, you know, just had to turn in.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Say that again?  You just had to turn it?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the pipe cutter?  Can you describe that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Okay.  At least the larger one was a fairly long arm, approximately, I don't know, two and a half feet long, and there was a circular piece to it that went around the pipe that had blades and you turn it on the pipe and then tighten it and turn more until it cut the pipe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You must have been a very strong 8 year old.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I don't remember it as being terribly difficult to do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It sounds difficult.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: It happens very gradually, you know, tighten a little bit, tighten a little bit.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood.  All right.  And that pipe, do you know what material that pipe was made of?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Steel.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know that or are you guessing?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. DONOHUE

text: If you know it, it's fine.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: My mind, I know it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood.  That's totally fine.  All right. So the steel pipe.  And what part of the system was that steel pipe for?  In other words, what was the pipe doing for the system?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Well, there were two different types of pipe. There were gas pipes, and there were steam pipes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you cut both of these pipes?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And both types were steel?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the gas pipes and the steam pipes look different?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Steam pipes were considerably larger.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could you estimate the diameter of the gas pipes?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: One inch?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how about the steam pipes?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Two and a half?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So let's go back to the unit itself.  Do you recall seeing the heating unit?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you describe that unit?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: The unit was probably 40 inches tall, two feet wide, four feet long, encased in metal covering, gray, with a water gauge on the outside, and a faucet.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The gray metal covering; do you know what type of metal that was?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Steel.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you present at the home when that unit arrived?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I don't remember it arriving.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you don't know whether your father picked it up or whether it was delivered?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No, I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The first time you saw that unit, was it already in place?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: As far as I remember, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where was that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: In the basement.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were never present while that unit was moved in any way?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did the unit arrive in one piece?  Strike that.  You don't know how it arrived. The first time you saw the unit, was it in one piece?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: The first time I remember seeing it it was in one piece.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what its power source was?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Natural gas.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did it have a name plate on it that you can recall?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No, it didn't have one or no, you can't recall?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I can't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you wouldn't know the model number of that piece of equipment?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you wouldn't know what year that piece of equipment was manufactured?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you don't know how your father purchased the piece of equipment?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I don't know for a fact yet I'm sure that it came through the Haverhill Gas Company.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I'll move to strike the nonresponsive of that answer.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: So you don't know how the unit was packaged when it arrived because you weren't there.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you don't know how it was delivered; is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see any documentation or written materials accompanying or with the unit?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Since the unit was already in place and out of its packaging, whatever that may have been, the first time you saw it you can't say today whether it came with any auxiliary materials, can you?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Objection.  This is to the term auxiliary materials.  If you know what that means.
speaker: MR. DONOHUE

text: Well, like the pipe are you talking about?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Okay.  There was pipe.  Whether they were delivered at the same time or not, I do not know that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood.  So you had mentioned pipe and you also mentioned a pipe dough; is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Dope.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Dope.  Apologies.  So you don't know whether that piping or whether that pipe dope came with the unit or whether it was purchased separately?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall any other auxiliary products, and if you need me to describe that I will but I think you know what I'm referring to, do you recall any others beside the pipe and the pipe dope?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No, I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you describe the pipe dope?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Came in a small metal can with a lid that popped off.  You'd apply it with a, well, a small paint brush.  Rather stiff paint brush.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said a stiff paint brush?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Well, the bristles were short and stiff.  Not like you'd use for painting a wall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How big was the can?  I know you said it was small, but could you describe --
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Maybe three inches in diameter and three inches tall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you use any other tools other than the paint brush?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: With using the pipe dope?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you recall any writing on that can of pipe dope?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is pipe dope a generic or a colloquial term or is that the name of the product?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: I do not know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your father call it pipe dope?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you do with the pipe dope?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Applied it to the threads of the pipe before they were connected.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  I'm going to ask you to describe that a little bit further.  So you applied this product to piping pieces that were not connected to the unit itself?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At some point those pipe pieces were connected to the unit; is that correct?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you do that work or did someone else do that work?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Attaching it to the boiler itself?  I don't know.  My father or I, possibly my brother.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you don't have a specific recollection of attaching those pipe pieces to the boiler itself?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you say how many pipe pieces were connected to the boiler?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Only through logic.  No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Fair enough.  And like I said, I know this is a long time ago so I don't want to put any undue pressure.  Just whatever you remember. So you would apply this pipe dope product to the pieces of pipe and then would the pieces of pipe also be connected to one another throughout the home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was that the majority of your job with respect to the installation of this heating system?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Do you mean just applying the pipe dope or connecting the pieces?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That whole process.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: The whole process.  Pipe dope connecting pieces.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then running them through the home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long was each piece of pipe?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: It would depend on how straight a run it would have before it needed to turn.  Variable.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Had you finished your answer?  I didn't mean to cut you off.
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that why you were cutting pieces, to make them fit throughout the home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were they connected to radiators throughout the home?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you work on those pieces of equipment at all?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As you were doing your role which was the cutting of the pipe and then the threading of the pipe and applying the pipe dope as I understand it, what was your brother doing if you can recall?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: Why is that?
speaker: MS. KAPLAN

speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MS. KAPLAN

text: No.

text: Yes.
